This is the perfect amount of challenge where the puzzles make you REALLY think, but not so difficult that you can't figure it out without a little trial & error.  I feel like escape rooms were born because of this game.  Many times puzzle games get to the point where the answers never make sense, even if you cheat and look up the answers... this one was never like that.  The answers always make sense and don't be tempted to look up the answers -- the fun is in the trial and error of figuring out the solutions.  Humor is abound and plentiful.  Has an emotional element that makes you want to binge your way through the entire story in one go.  Enjoy this classic -- It ages really well, even over a decade after its release.

An all time classic game. Myself and my assistant Caroline lived a good life, and this tale is a reflection of that journey. It is a shame those lab boys had to go and shove Caroline into a computer and ruin everything! Ahhh jeez who am I kidding, I have asbestos, that should be the least of my worries.

A Classic Valve game with puzzle mechanics and a teeny meeny lore, pretty solid game in my opinion. If you haven't played it go check it out. 

8/10
The campaign is great, the singleplayer stuff is fun, and co-op is a blast. Its not nearly as grueling to 100% as the original portal, but still takes some time and skill.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
